title: Apple TV App Introduces 3D Movies on Vision Pro
originSummary: Apple has released a list of the first 3D movies available on its Vision Pro platform on the Apple TV app.
The redesigned app now supports 3D movies and features a 3D logo resembling the shape of the Apple Vision Pro.
Some blockbuster movies are included, but some titles showcased at the Vision Pro launch are still not available.
commentSummary: Apple has added support for 3D movies on its Vision Pro on the Apple TV app.
The app now displays a 3D logo, mirroring the design of the Apple Vision Pro.
While some popular movies are available, not all titles showcased during the Vision Pro launch are currently included.
The Apple Vision Pro will be launching in the US in early next year, with a price tag of approximately $3,500. International releases will follow.

title: Apple Vision Pro Headset Teases 3D Movie Line-Up, But Questions Remain
originSummary: Apple's upcoming Vision Pro headset is generating excitement in the XR industry.
A new update for the Apple TV app has revealed a 3D movie category with films supposedly supporting the feature, such as Jurassic World: Dominion, Trolls, and Warcraft.
It is unclear if these films will be accessible to consumers or only developers with devkits, and the resolution and framerate of the films are also unknown.
commentSummary: Apple's upcoming Vision Pro headset is creating buzz in the XR industry.
The Apple TV app update has unveiled a 3D movie category, suggesting the headset will support 3D movies.
It's unclear if these films will be accessible to consumers or limited to developers with devkits. The resolution and framerate details are also unknown.

title: Apple TV app adds 3D movies ahead of Vision Pro release
originSummary: Apple has introduced 3D versions of movies on its Apple TV app, potentially hinting at the upcoming release of the Apple Vision Pro headset.
The tvOS 17.2 beta includes a selection of movies with a 3D logo that resembles a headset.
It is currently unclear why Apple has added 3D movies to the app before the Vision Pro headset's expected release in 2024.
commentSummary: Apple has introduced 3D versions of movies on its Apple TV app.
This move is seen as a possible preparation for the upcoming release of the Apple Vision Pro headset.
It is unclear why Apple is adding 3D movies now, considering that the Vision Pro headset is not expected to be released until 2024.

title: Apple Vision Pro Leak Reveals Possible 3D Movies Launch
originSummary: Apple may be planning to introduce 3D movies on its upcoming Apple Vision Pro headset, according to a leak.
The recently discovered list of movies in tvOS 17.2 beta suggests a diverse range of genres and could potentially rekindle interest in 3D TVs.

While Apple has not disclosed specific details about resolution or frame rate, it is anticipated that these films will incorporate stereoscopic 3D technology, and there is speculation about the possibility of 3D content on the Apple TV+ platform.
commentSummary: Apple may be planning to introduce 3D movies on its upcoming Apple Vision Pro headset, according to a leaked list of movies found in the tvOS 17.2 beta.
This move could potentially reignite interest in 3D TVs, as it suggests a wider adoption of 3D technology.
There is speculation that Apple may also release 3D content on its Apple TV+ platform, although specific details about the resolution and frame rate are not yet available.

title: Samsung and Google Delay VR Headset Launch to Take On Apple's Vision Pro
originSummary: Samsung, Google, and Qualcomm are revamping their plans to develop a mixed reality headset to compete with Apple's Vision Pro.
The project has been delayed, with Samsung focusing on obtaining higher resolution screens for the headset.
The launch is now projected to take place in late 2024, with a production target of 30,000 units for the year.
commentSummary: Samsung, Google, and Qualcomm are joining forces to develop a mixed reality headset to compete with Apple's Vision Pro.
The project has experienced delays, as Samsung is working on improving the screen resolution for the headset.
The launch of the headset is now anticipated to be at the end of 2024, with a target production of 30,000 units for the year.

title: Samsung Develops 'Infinite' Mixed Reality Headset to Rival Apple's Vision Pro: Report
originSummary: Samsung is developing a mixed-reality headset called 'Infinite' to rival Apple's Vision Pro headset.
The project involves collaboration between Samsung, Google, and Qualcomm.
The release date for the 'Infinite' headset is expected to be in late 2024.
commentSummary: Samsung is developing a mixed-reality headset called 'Infinite' to rival Apple's Vision Pro headset.
The project is a joint effort between Samsung, Google, and Qualcomm.
The release date for the 'Infinite' headset is anticipated to be in late 2024.

title: The Apple Vision Pro's first 3D movies may soon show up in the App Store
originSummary: Multiple 3D movies have been found on the Apple TV app, suggesting a possible upcoming launch of the Apple Vision Pro headset.
The movies, including popular titles like Jurassic World Dominion and Shrek, will feature a 3D-compatible icon.

Speculation arises that Apple may have developed a new file format for the Vision Pro headset, as these movies had previous 3D cinema releases. The Vision Pro is anticipated to provide an immersive and comfortable stereoscopic 3D experience, potentially leading to a resurgence of 3D TVs.
commentSummary: The Apple TV app has recently added multiple 3D movies, potentially in preparation for the launch of the Apple Vision Pro headset.
Titles like Jurassic World Dominion and Shrek are included, each with a 3D-compatible icon.
The Vision Pro headset is expected to offer an immersive and comfortable experience with its use of stereoscopic 3D, and this support for 3D movies may lead to a resurgence of 3D TVs.

title: Samsung Developing Mixed-Reality Headset to Rival Apple's Vision Pro
originSummary: Samsung is said to be working on a mixed-reality headset to compete with Apple's Vision Pro headset.
The launch of Samsung's XR headset may be delayed until late 2024 due to Apple's announcement.

Rumored features of the Samsung XR headset include Android and Snapdragon chipset, as well as OLEDoS displays by Samsung Display. However, this information is speculative and no official details are available yet.
commentSummary: Samsung is said to be working on a mixed-reality headset to compete with Apple's Vision Pro headset.
The launch of Samsung's XR headset may be delayed until late 2024 due to Apple's announcement.

Rumored features for Samsung's headset include running on Android, a Snapdragon chipset, and possibly using OLEDoS displays provided by Samsung Display. However, these details are speculative and no official information has been released. The competition between Apple and Samsung in terms of innovation and technology is expected to continue.

title: Samsung Galaxy AR Headset Set to Compete with Apple Vision Pro in 2024
originSummary: Samsung is reportedly working on an AR headset, codenamed "Infinite(muhan)," to rival Apple's Vision Pro headset.
The Samsung headset is expected to launch in December 2024, but in limited quantities compared to Apple's product.
It is rumored that the Samsung headset will be powered by Qualcomm's second-generation XR chipset and will likely come with a high price tag.
Apple is projected to ship over 600,000 units of its Vision Pro headset in 2024.
The competition between Apple and Samsung in the AR headset market is anticipated to intensify in 2025-2026.
commentSummary: Samsung is reportedly working on an AR headset, codenamed "Infinite(muhan)", to compete with Apple's Vision Pro headset.
The Samsung headset is expected to be released in December 2024 but in limited quantities compared to Apple's product.
Apple is projected to ship over 600,000 units of its Vision Pro headset in 2024, indicating a growing competition between Apple and Samsung in the AR headset market in the years to come.
